attributes.comment:
I think the proposed raise in immigration fees is misguided for two reasons. First, I
think it's going to have the obvious effect of discouraging people (who don't have a
lot of money) from filing. I think we should be encouraging the 12 million people
here illegally to emerge from the shadows and make themselves legal, not
discouraging them. Secondly, I seriously doubt that this is the best way to
acheive the stated goal of eliminating backlogs. If they want to eliminate backlogs
so bad, why is USCIS firing numerous adjudicators? When has any fee increase
ever eliminated the backlog, like they always say it will? Don't get me wrong, I
think 95% of the people that work at USCIS are doing their job well. But if you
really want to eliminate backlog, stop hiring people at the Service Centers on a
contract, temporary basis for close to minimun wage.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Michael J. Ponder
